result.execSummary:
The defendant Deandre D Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  If applicable, out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages.  To be paid within one year of  leaving the  HOC.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for school only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre D Martin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deandre D Martin in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Defendant Deandre D Martin in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.   

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 70 days time served, Huber privileges for school ONLY.  

Restitution is set at $0 (Zero).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, if applicable, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages. To be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction.   If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices in court, defendant Deandre D Martin not in court, in custody.  
Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter; adjourned date selected before Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maxwell M. or Co-Defendant Xavier Wade

Defendant Deandre D Martin in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Deandre D Martin in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Jeffrey Conen, Branch 30,  in Room 635 of the Courthouse.   Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Deandre D Martin
Current: 4314 N 62nd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 07-29-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
